description.short: The ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire.
description.long: Persepolis is an ancient UNESCO World Heritage Site in Iran, showcasing grand ruins, intricate carvings, and a glimpse into the grandeur of the Achaemenid Empire, founded by Darius the Great around 518 BCE.

description.short: A historic square in Isfahan, also a UNESCO site.
description.long: Naqsh-e Jahan Square, also known as Imam Square, is one of the largest city squares in the world, featuring stunning Safavid-era architecture, including the Shah Mosque and the Ali Qapu Palace.

image.alt: View of Naqsh-e Jahan Square in Isfahan

description.short: A historic palace complex in Tehran.
description.long: The Golestan Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a masterpiece of Qajar-era architecture. It features beautiful gardens, ornate halls, and the iconic Marble Throne.

image.alt: Exterior view of Golestan Palace in Tehran
image.license: Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0, Diego Delso (https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q28147777)

description.short: The capital of the Achaemenid Empire.
description.long: Pasargadae is an archaeological site in Iran and the first dynastic capital of the Achaemenid Empire. It is the location of the Tomb of Cyrus the Great and other historical monuments.

image.alt: Tomb of Cyrus the Great in Pasargadae
image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A desert city with unique Persian architecture.
description.long: Yazd is a historic city recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Known for its wind catchers, mud-brick buildings, and Zoroastrian heritage, Yazd offers a blend of cultural and architectural wonders.

description.short: An ancient city and scenic desert landscapes.
description.long: Kerman is a historic city known for its cultural sites, while the nearby Shahdad Desert offers breathtaking views of the Kaluts, a unique desert landscape formed by wind erosion.

image.alt: Kaluts in Shahdad Desert near Kerman

description.short: A significant religious site in Mashhad.
description.long: The Imam Reza Shrine in Mashhad is one of the holiest sites in Shia Islam. It features stunning architecture, a museum, and is a major pilgrimage destination for millions of visitors annually.

description.short: A medieval castle surrounded by lush forests.
description.long: Rudkhan Castle is a historic fortress located in the Gilan Province of Iran. It is known for its stunning architecture and scenic views of the surrounding forested mountains.

description.short: A vibrant marketplace and UNESCO site.
description.long: The Tabriz Historic Bazaar Complex is one of the oldest bazaars in the Middle East. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a hub of commerce, culture, and architecture.

description.short: A historic fortress with a fascinating history.
description.long: Alamut Castle, also known as the Castle of the Assassins, is perched on a rocky peak in the Alborz mountains. It offers stunning views and a glimpse into the history of the Ismaili sect.

image.alt: Alamut Castle on a rocky peak
image.license: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported,  Alireza Javaheri
